リサーチ・ペーパー(締切日はセメスターの終わり): 本文を6,000字以内で執筆し、600字以内の要約を最初に、参考文献を最後につけること。(英語の場合、本文と参考文献を含めて3,000語以内で執筆し、300語以内の要約を最初につけるこ。)。提出が遅れた場合、1日あたり20%の減点。
出席と議論への参加: 指定された文献をあらかじめ読んだうえで、講義に出席し、積極的に議論に参加することが求められます。

議論すべきポイントの事前提出: 履修者は、指定された文献を批判的に読み、1コマあたり1つの議論すべきポイントを見つけ、3文から構成される1パラグラフ(250字くらい)で議論をまとめて下さい。議論には、次の3つの要素を含めて下さい。(1)指定された文献のなかから論じたいポイントを引用(著者名、出版年、ページ)する、(2)著者が主張するその論点について批判的に考察・分析する、(3)自分自身の代替的な見方や解釈を提示し、さらなる研究の必要を提案する。1パラグラフの発表できるような完成した文章として作成してください。当日前に、あらかじめWaseda Moodleで提出してください。

n.c: 1-page plan for your End-term Research Paper (title, sub-title, abstract, outlines, and 3-5 important reference materials)

The End-term Research Paper: A research paper should be written within the limit of 3,000 words, excluding the reference. A summary of less than 300 words should be attached. You can submit it in the Waseda Moodle, as a file in either MS Word or PDF file. Late submission will be penalized by 20% per day.
Attendance and proactive participation in discussion. It is important for participants to complete required readings before coming to the class. 0-1 point for each session.

One discussion point (a paragraph of less than 100 words) for each session, with some reference to the required reading materials, or a seminar you attended. Late submission is not allowed. 0-2 points for each session.    You read assigned papers critically, identify 1 discussion point per session, and write your discussion in 1 paragraph (up to 150 words). Your discussion should include the following 3 elements: 1) Quote a discussion point from the assigned papers, 2) Critically assess and analyze the point argued by the author, and 3) Present your own alternative perspective or interpretation, suggesting needs for further research.    It should not be too long. Imagine yourself attending an international conference, and making a comment on a draft document circulated among participants. You may have only 3 minutes to make a brief but clear comment on the paper in order to contribute to the on-going debate at the United Nations, ASEAN, EU, WHO, etc.    -------------------SAMPLE-------------------   According to Benedek, some human rights, such as freedom from torture and slavery, are too essential to be restricted, but others may be restricted when the public good takes precedence over the individual right (Benedek, 2012, p.156). I believe that this perspective may be applied for public health measures taken to combat COVID-19, such as quarantining patients and restricting travels, but I am concerned about some political leaders committing individual rights abuses in the name of public health. Therefore, I propose a new study on how the Siracusa Principles (Benedek, 2012, p.157) can guide us how to balance between public health and individual civil and political rights in our combat against COVID-19.  -------------------SAMPLE-------------------

p: Leadership in global health affairs and governance in achieving the SDGs 3 (health) and 2 (nutrition)

b: Japanese Politics and Diplomacy  (E)
c: 日本政治・外交論(E)

n.c: See Reports below.

Choose one from questions 1-5 and one from questions 6-10 below (Notes and references are INDISPENSABLE).    1) What were the differences, internationally and domestically, between China and Japan as regards to conditions at the time of their contact with the Western Powers in the mid-19th century? In other words, why did China fail and Japan succeeded in adapting themselves to a West-led international society?    2) What was the significance of the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95) in the context of international system? A comparison with the Russo-Japanese War (1904-05) will be helpful.    3) What were the short-term and long-term effects of Japan’s participation in the First World War? Style and nature of Japan’s involvement in the War are very important in answering the question. Do not forget to refer to the so-called racial equality clause dispute at the Paris Peace Conference of 1919.    4) Why China and Japan could not come to terms with each other in the 1930s? Was the general war between the two countries a natural course of history? Discuss.    5) Explain and analyze the origins and causes of US-Japan confrontation that eventually led to the Asia-Pacific War. Do not forget to refer to the US-Japan negotiations of 1941.    6) What is ‘Yoshida Doctrine’? In what way did it formulate post-war Japan and in what manner is it affecting Japan’s foreign policy to date?    7) What made so-called Japan’s economic miracle in the late 1950s-early 1970s possible? Explain from both domestic and international conditions.    8) Explain United Nations-Japan relations in historical perspective. Issues of international security including peace keeping operations should be included. Comparison between Japan’s experiences in the League of Nations will be helpful.    9) In what way was Japan involved in the creation of ‘Two China question’?   Explain from historical background and contemporary policy.    10) Make an overview of Japanese colonial experience and explain in what ways it affects present-day Japanese relations with neighboring countries. Reference to disputes regarding interpretation of history is indispensable.

b: Japanese Politics and Diplomacy (J)
c: 日本政治・外交論 (J)

n.c: 行なわない。

受講後に提出するレポートで評価する。以下の課題から2題選択してもらう。開講時までに若干の変更はありえるが、課題の基本的内容は変わらない。以下の設問1―6から1問、7-12から1問、合計2問選択し、各問3000―5000字程度で解答せよ。配点は各50点。100点満点で60点以上を合格とする。註と参考文献を付すこと。ウェブサイトは学術的性質のもののみ使用可。    1.19世紀後半、西欧中心の国際社会への参入過程で日本と中国には大きな違いがあった。    その違いが何に由来するか、両国の国内要因・国際要因の双方から分析せよ。  2.いわゆる不平等条約改正の過程を概観した上で、日本がそれに成功した要因に    ついて説明せよ。  3.日清戦争と日露戦争の違いを国際社会システムの観点から分析せよ。  4.日本が植民地帝国となった過程を概観した上で、統治国としての日本の功罪を論ぜよ。    5.パリ講和会議において日本は「人種平等条項」を国際連盟規約に挿入することを主張    して失敗した。その過程を概観した上で、失敗の原因を分析せよ。  6.1930年代における日中衝突は必然的であったのか。回避可能・不可能の双方の    観点について分析せよ。  (以上から1問)    7.アジア太平洋戦争にいたる日米関係の変遷を概観した上で、日本の敗因を分析せよ。  8.アジア太平洋戦争敗戦後の日本の外交政策にはいくつかの理論的選択肢があったが、    それらの選択肢を概観した上で、現実に日本がとった路線について説明せよ。  9.いわゆる「吉田ドクトリン」の功罪を、内政・外交双方の観点から分析せよ。  10.「高度経済成長」が実現された原因を国内政治、国際政治双方の視点から分析せよ。  11.1956年の加盟以来、日本は「国連中心主義」を標榜してきたが、その理念と    現実について説明せよ。PKOに関する論議を必ず含めること。  12.いわゆる「ふたつの中国」問題に日本はどのように関与してきたか論ぜよ。  (以上から1問)
